Package Database.Helpers

Class DatabaseToken

java.lang.Object
Database.Helpers.DatabaseToken
public class DatabaseToken
extends java.lang.Object
This is the class that creates a token for authentication when the user that has logged in tries to access the database The token is stored in a HashMap ordered (Username, String[token, time])

  • Constructor Details

    • DatabaseToken

      public DatabaseToken()
      The Constructor of the token which will be used for authentication

  • Method Details

    • verifyToken

      public boolean verifyToken​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String token)
      Checks to see if the token is currently active (if not removes the token)
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the current user
      token - the token sent by the client side to be checked
      Returns:
      true if valid token, false if token expired or invalid

    • createToken

      public boolean createToken​(java.lang.String username)
      Creates a token that is stored in the database
      Parameters:
      username - the user that the token is attached too
      Returns:
      returns false if the user already has a token, and returns true if the user had a token generated

    • getToken

      public java.lang.String getToken​(java.lang.String username)
      Adds the user information and gets the token for the client to store
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the currently active user on the client
      Returns:
      the randomized token

    • getStoredTime

      private java.lang.String getStoredTime​(java.lang.String username)
      Gets the stored time fot the token
      Parameters:
      username - the name of the currently active user
      Returns:
      the stored time

    • removeAuthentication

      public void removeAuthentication​(java.lang.String username)
      Removes the values from the TreeMap for the user since the token has expired
      Parameters:
      username - the user to be removed from authentication

    • returnTime

      private java.lang.String returnTime​(int removeDayCount)
      Gets the time and can remove days if needed
      Parameters:
      removeDayCount - the number of days to be removed from the date created (only used for token checking for expiry)
      Returns:
      the current time in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss
